releases.details: Part of the The Collection: Season Two box set
Released as Doctor Who: The Rescue/The Romans

notes: This was the first story under Dennis Spooner as script editor, though he is not listed in the credits because he had little to do since much of the job was given to his predecessor David Whitaker and thus he is not credited.
The story was commissioned on 1 November 1964, the day after his contract with the BBC for his position as script editor had expired.
The story was originally known as Doctor Who and Tanni. It was originally intended that the new companion would be named Tanni. Other names considered for Vicki were Valerie, Millie and Lukki.
Vicki's last name is not revealed in this story, nor is it ever mentioned on-screen in any future stories.

Koquillion was originally credited as being played by Sydney Wilson (a combination of the first name of Sydney Newman and the surname of Donald Wilson respectively) to preserve the "whodunnit" aspect of the story.
"The Powerful Enemy" boasts the first occasion on which a sound effect is laid over footage of the TARDIS re-materialising.
The appearance of the two Dido people in "Desperate Measures" is never explained.

in_universe_mythology: The Doctor speaks of the peaceful Dido people he had met previously.

continuity_notes: Reference is made to Susan's departure and the Doctor momentarily forgets that she has gone.
The crew discuss their problems with caves from previous stories.

plot.plot_summary: The Doctor, Ian and Barbara arrive on the planet Dido, where they find a crashed spaceship, the UK-201. The only two survivors are terrorized by the monster Koquillion. But Koquillion is actually Bennett, the murderer of the other crew members, who is trying to cover up his crime and take the young girl Vicki back to Earth with him. The Doctor exposes Bennett's deception, leading to Bennett's death. Vicki, now orphaned, decides to join the Doctor, Ian and Barbara in the TARDIS and continue on their adventures.
